div.l: And vp he rist and bi the wenche he crepte
This wenche lay vp right and faste slepte
Til ho so nygh was er she mygh espie
That hit had ben to late for to crie
And shortly for to seyn thei were aton
Now play Aleyn for y wol speke of Iohn
Â¶ This Iohn light stille a forlong wey or two
And to hym self he maketh routh and wo
Allas quod he this is a wikked Iape
Now may I sayn that I is but an ape
Yit has my felowe som what for his harme
He has the Millere doughter in his arme
He auntred hym and has his nedes sped
And I ly as a drafsak in my bed
And whan this Iape is tald a nother day
I shal be halden a daffe a Cokenay
I wil a rise and auntre it bi my faith
Vnhardy is vnsely thus men seith
And vp he ros and softely he wente
Vn to the cradel and in his hand it hente
And bar it softe vn to his beddes feet
Soon after this the wif hir rowtyng leet
And gan a wake and went hir out to pisse
And cam a gayn and gan hir cradel mysse
And groped heere and ther but she found o o non
Allas quod she I had al moost mys goangangon
I Had Had I had almost gon th th to the clerkes bed
div.note: "I" added in the left margin; no element working to indicate that placement.
div.l: Ey benedicite than hadde I foule y sped
And foorth she gooth til she the cradel fond
She gropeth al way forther with hir hond
And fond the bed and thoght nat but good
By cause that the cradel by it stood
And neste wher she was for it was derk
But faire and wel she creep in by the clerk
